The user spits flames from their mouth that, like a [[wikipedia:dragon|dragon]]'s, quickly travel forward in a straight direction. Upon contact with a target, the affected area is engulfed in flames. Whereas the [[Great Fireball Technique]] will burn everything in the vicinity, the Dragon Fire Technique is more narrowly focused at its initial target, likened to a projectile.<ref name="d1"/> When first used by [[Sasuke Uchiha]], he uses [[Manipulating Windmill Triple Blades|wire strings]] to guide the Dragon Fire Technique to his target's face.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 49</ref> The anime later shows it burning through a line of enemies, with the flames moving from one enemy to the next.<ref>''Naruto'' episode 133</ref> Despite these two cases, the Dragon Fire Technique seemingly does not require a medium through which to be transmitted.

== Trivia ==
* {{translation|"Ryūka"|流下}} can also be translated as "downward flow", which fits the nature of this technique.
* In [[Mission: Protect the Waterfall Village!]], the blaze splits into multiple smaller dragons of fire that strike the foe from multiple directions.
* [[Jiraiya]] uses this technique in "[[The New Erotic Ninjutsu Completed!!]]", which was later [[Omake#Naruto's New Sexy Technique|adapted]] in ''[[Naruto: Shippūden]]''.
